steps.notes: Collection of carbonaceous chondrite regolith from meteorite impact sites. Rare (1-2% of lunar surface) but critical for carbon and volatile extraction. Slower than generic mining due to site prospecting and travel.

recipe_def.notes:
Collection process for carbonaceous regolith from CM/CI chondrite impact sites.
Targets areas with visible dark material enrichment and organic compound signatures.
Rich in carbon (2-5%), water (10%), and volatiles - essential for ISRU operations.

steps.notes: Extract carbon reductant from carbonaceous regolith feedstock.

recipe_def.assumptions: Carbonaceous regolith feedstock available for small-scale carbon recovery.
recipe_def.notes: ISRU extraction route for carbon reductant; drying and sizing steps deferred.

recipe_def.assumptions: Local production path added; replace import placeholder with real production pathway.
recipe_def.notes: Manufacturing recipe for carbon reducing agent using carbon_reductant input.

steps.notes: Extract ilmenite from regolith; yields generated in process.

recipe_def.assumptions: Extraction yields ~0.6 kg ilmenite per 1 kg regolith input; tailings ~0.4 kg.
recipe_def.notes: In-situ ilmenite extraction from regolith; placeholder yields and mass balance.
recipe_def.name: Recipe for ilmenite extraction from regolith

steps.notes: Single-step carbothermal reduction from ore to iron pig/ingot.

recipe_def.notes: Direct path from iron ore/ilmenite to iron_pig_or_ingot using the iron_smelting_reduction_v0 process.

steps.notes: Hot roll steel ingot into bar or billet shapes

recipe_def.notes: Production of steel bar and billet stock from ingots. Processing time ~1.5 hours per kg. ~5% loss to scale and trim.

steps.notes: Cast fastener blanks and washer stock in batch molds
Machine threads and washer profiles from cast blanks
Heat treat fasteners for strength and spring properties
Inspect heat-treated fasteners for hardness and dimensional checks
Sort fasteners by size (M6, M8, M10, M12), count, and kit

recipe_def.assumptions:
Simplified fastener manufacturing from metal alloy bulk to finished kit:
- Cast blanks for bolts, nuts, and washers
- Machine threads and profiles
- Heat treat for strength and spring properties
- Final inspection and kitting

Input materials: 2.0 kg steel_stock
Output: 1.0 kg complete fastener kit per BOM specification
Scrap rate: ~50% from casting/machining losses (conservative placeholder)
recipe_def.notes:
Simplified local recipe for fastener_kit_medium production.

Kit composition per bom_fastener_kit_medium_v0:
- 720g hex bolts M6-M12 in various lengths (76 pieces total)
- 180g hex nuts M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 75g flat washers M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 30g lock washers M6-M12 (60 pieces total)
Total: ~366 fasteners, 1.0 kg net weight

Manufacturing process details:
1. Casting: Form blanks for bolts, nuts, and washers
2. Threading: Cut external threads on bolts, tap nuts
3. Heat treatment: Quench and temper bolts to grade 8.8 equivalent, harden lock washers
4. Inspection: Verify hardness and dimensional checks
5. Kitting: Sort by size, verify counts, package in compartmented container
References detailed specification in design/memos/fastener_kit_specification.md
Most commonly used fastener kit in the KB (107 BOMs reference this item)

steps.notes: Cast bearing races and rolling elements from bearing steel
Machine and heat treat bearing components to HRC 58-64
Precision grind races and rolling elements to final tolerances
Assemble bearings with cage, lubricate, seal, and test

recipe_def.assumptions: Heavy-duty bearing set (4 kg) for large motors and machinery; precision ground races and rolling elements; heat-treated to bearing-grade hardness; includes lubrication and final testing.
recipe_def.notes: Comprehensive 13-step recipe covering steel processing, precision machining, ball/roller forming, heat treatment, assembly, lubrication, and testing. Suitable for 70-100mm bore heavy industrial bearings.

steps.notes: Cut pipe sections and fitting blanks
Machine threads, flange faces, and sealing surfaces
Inspect threads and sealing surfaces

recipe_def.notes: Manufacture pipe and fittings set for fluid systems.

steps.notes: Cast spindle housing from steel (approx mass raw ~40-60 kg).
Machine bearing journals, taper bore, mounting faces to precision tolerances
Grind critical bearing surfaces and taper to final tolerance
Install precision spindle bearings with thermal fit or press fit
Assemble drive pulley, seals, and mounting hardware
Dynamic balance spindle assembly to minimize runout

recipe_def.assumptions: Spindle housing from steel casting; precision bearings sourced or imported; final assembly tuned for low runout.
recipe_def.notes:
Placeholder recipe to manufacture spindle_assembly_precision; uses standard precision machining and assembly steps.

Sequential flow: cast  machine  grind  install bearings  assemble  balance.
Assemble spindle precision assembly with sealed bearing set into lathe spindle and bearings
recipe_def.name: Recipe for lathe spindle and bearings

steps.notes: Cast lathe bed from cast iron (~400-450 kg) with integral ways and headstock mounting area; allow extended cooling and stress relieving (days to weeks)
Weld steel reinforcements to bed if fabricated design; fabricate and weld headstock housing from steel plate
Precision machine bed ways (V-ways and flat ways) to extremely tight tolerances (0.01 mm), machine headstock bore for spindle bearings, drill/tap mounting holes
Scrape ways by hand to achieve final precision and straightness (0.005 mm over full length), verify parallelism of ways
Grind and polish critical surfaces, apply protective coating (paint or oil) to prevent rust
Verify straightness, flatness, and parallelism of ways using precision straight edge and autocollimator; check headstock bore concentricity

recipe_def.assumptions: Precision lathe bed and headstock assembly. 500 kg cast iron bed with precision-ground ways and integrated or mounted headstock housing. Bed length typically 1-2 meters with V-ways and flat ways for carriage and tailstock travel. Headstock houses spindle bearings and drive system. Requires extreme precision - way straightness and flatness within 0.005-0.01 mm over full length, parallelism between ways within 0.01 mm. Critical component determining lathe accuracy. Cast iron chosen for vibration damping and dimensional stability.
recipe_def.notes: Manufacturing of lathe bed and headstock. Total fabrication time ~120 hours. Extremely demanding precision machining and hand scraping required for machine tool accuracy. Casting must be stress-relieved for dimensional stability. Final precision achieved by hand scraping ways - traditional machine tool building technique. Most time-consuming and skill-intensive component of lathe construction. Accuracy of this component determines turning precision of entire lathe.

recipe_def.assumptions: Medium bearing set (1.5 kg) for general machinery. Precision ground races and balls, heat-treated to bearing-grade hardness, includes lubrication and seals.
recipe_def.notes: Eight-step recipe covering ring forging, turning, heat treatment, precision grinding, rolling element grinding, cage forming, and final assembly for 35-45mm bore bearings. Uses in-situ steel stock and alloy feedstock; grease and seals still required.
